info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 3:18PM EDT until July 19 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following county, La Porte.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 218 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Michigan City, La Porte, Westville, Trail Creek, New Carlisle, Long Beach, Pottawattamie Park, Michiana Shores, Kingsbury, Springville, Byron, Pinola, Rolling Prarie, Stillwell, Hesston, Waterford, Pinhook, Fish Lake, Pottawattomie Park and Hudson Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
